msContents.summary: Although the foliation appears to be continuing, the verses in the manuscript are arranged very differently from those in the printed versions. Either the lines are skipped, or it is a selection of verses. Additionally, it's possible that the manuscript folios are disorganized due to their fragile condition. The manuscript requires careful attention because it is severely damaged. On folio 52 verses 238, 244 from 8th chapter are identified. The last line of the folio is of the verse 251 from the 8th chapter. On folio [53?] verses 219 220 from the 8th chapter are spotted. On folio 82 verses 261, 262 from chapter 9 are found. [86v?] has verses 203-205 from the 11th chapter are identified.

support.p: Thick wooden guard covers. Looks newer than the original manuscript. Originally thin palm leaf is used as a cover but it is damaged so new wooden covers are used to conserve the mansucript.

extent.measure: 2 new and 2 old guard covers, 86 written folio

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil numerals in the left margin. Mostly margin is damaged hence nuemrarion is lost.
